abstract: Military prosecutors in Poland charge two Russian air traffic controllers in 2010 plane crash that killed Pres Lech Kaczynski and 95 top-ranking officials, possibly adding to strained relations between countries; details of charges are not made public but controllers could face up to eight years in prison.
lead_paragraph: The 2010 plane crash in western Russia killed President Lech Kaczynski and 95 top-ranking officials traveling with him.

headline.main: Poland Charges Russian Air Traffic Controllers in Crash
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Poland: Russian Air Controllers Charged in ’10 Crash

snippet: The 2010 plane crash in western Russia killed President Lech Kaczynski and 95 top-ranking officials traveling with him.
